While many of the known hexatic LC compounds exhibit a second-order or very weak first-order Sm-A–Hex-B phase transition [ 17, 39, 68, 69], this transition in the freely suspended films of the n-pentyl-4′−n-pentanoyloxy-biphenyl-4-carboxylate (54COOBC) compound is clearly of the first order. The coexistence of two phases is a convincing indication of the first-order Sm-A–Hex-B transition in the 54COOBC films.
